body: (Needs someone who knows and loves Windows)

(same here :smiley: - but there's some fun to be found in the learning and the doing!) Some tests with stfileinfo show that Scanner.Blocks happily consumes a handle to a deduped file, producing the same results as a normal version of the same file. This indicates that the existing functionality already handles reparse points fairly well. I'll see if I can hack together a proof of concept that behaves acceptably for a read-only master.

issue.title: NTFS Reparse Point proof-of-concept

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Lightly-tested modifications for read-only scenario in #1845. Deduplicated files seem to be correctly scanned and synced.

Note, this has not been tested with a read-write folder, so odds are that things will break when attempting to overwrite something that is still incorrectly perceived as a symlink.

body:
After some additional digging, it looks like any call to os.Stat() will fail when it hits a deduplicated file. Properly handling this will require changing every os.Stat() call to os.Lstat() with a sanity check and appropriate handling.

By the looks of it, os.Stat() is [blindly checking](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/439b32936367c3efd0dadab48dd51202e1a510f1/src/os/stat_windows.go#L57) for the Symlink bit, then calling Readlink which [bails out](https://github.com/golang/go/blob/439b32936367c3efd0dadab48dd51202e1a510f1/src/syscall/syscall_windows.go#L1005-L1007) because it doesn't know about the Deduplication tag.

issue.title: Folder not syncing fully....
issue.body:
I have a folder on a windows 2012r2 (de-duplication enabled on the volume) the total folder size according to windows is 15GB with 32,477 files. 
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3219132/12242474/5bed916e-b867-11e5-9266-54fb65358707.png)

But Syncthing only sees 108 MB with 15,795 files
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3219132/12242503/841cf6e8-b867-11e5-9887-10518493c940.png)

There is nothing special about the folder or the files in it, mainly scripts & binaries. Syncthing runs under the local administrator account.

issue.title: index not up to date after scan folder api called from Filewatcher application (synctrayzor)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Hi,

We have Syncthing running via SyncTrayzor with a single instance on a Windows 2012 R2 server hosting multiple folders, each of which is connected to a single Syncthing instance running via SyncTrayzor on a users laptop.  The folders on the server are also shared via SMB for when the user logs on to a device other than their dedicated laptop.

The folders on the server are populated with data and we install and set up a laptop with a fresh folder to synchronise (this folder contains the basic structure of a windows documents folder, with a few folder redirections, such as desktop and links)

After the initial sync on a most laptops we notice errors such as these (specific to the user in question)

The Downloads.lnk file is present on both sides when the sync starts and will often result in a conflict file being created.

```
2016-05-03 11:19:43.5268 #1160 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.EventWatcher.SyncthingEventWatcher: Received 6 events 
2016-05-03 11:19:43.5268 #1160 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.SyncthingProcessRunner: [UVYNR] 11:19:43 INFO: Puller (folder "willenbrocka", file "My Settings\\links\\Downloads.lnk"): pull: peers who had this file went away, or the file has changed while syncing. will retry later 
```

This error goes away after a rescan (we have it set to 1 hour as we are using the Filewatcher in Synctrayzor for the immediate changes and frequent scanning of 200+ folders causes huge IO on the server) however as per the log below SyncTrayzor has already successfully sent an API request to scan the folder

Canton7 was extremely helpful and we concluded that SyncTrayzor was sending the API call to Syncthing without issue on [SyncTrayzor issue  256](https://github.com/canton7/SyncTrayzor/issues/256) (starts about halfway down on my reply starting "This might not be related, but we are seeing this popping up in the logs quite regularly,"

```
2016-05-03 11:18:22.7096 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.EventWatcher.SyncthingEventWatcher: <ItemStarted ID=3284 Time=03/05/2016 11:18:22 Item=my settings\links\Downloads.lnk Folder=willenbrocka Type=File Action=Update>
2016-05-03 11:18:22.7096 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.TransferHistory.SyncthingTransferHistory: Item started. Folder: willenbrocka, Item: my settings\links\Downloads.lnk, Type: File, Action: Update
2016-05-03 11:18:22.7096 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.TransferHistory.SyncthingTransferHistory: Created file transfer: <FileTransfer Folder=willenbrocka Path=my settings\links\Downloads.lnk Status=Started ItemType=File ActionType=Update Started=03/05/2016 10:18:22 Finished=>
2016-05-03 11:18:22.7096 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.EventWatcher.SyncthingEventWatcher: <ItemStarted ID=3285 Time=03/05/2016 11:18:22 Item=AppData\Bookmarks Folder=willenbrocka Type=File Action=Metadata>
2016-05-03 11:18:22.7096 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.TransferHistory.SyncthingTransferHistory: Item started. Folder: willenbrocka, Item: AppData\Bookmarks, Type: File, Action: Metadata
2016-05-03 11:18:22.7096 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.EventWatcher.SyncthingEventWatcher: <ItemFinished ID=3286 Time=03/05/2016 11:18:22 Item=AppData\Bookmarks Folder=willenbrocka Error=>
2016-05-03 11:18:22.7276 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.TransferHistory.SyncthingTransferHistory: Item finished. Folder: willenbrocka, Item: AppData\Bookmarks, Type: File, Action: Metadata
2016-05-03 11:18:22.7276 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.EventWatcher.SyncthingEventWatcher: <ItemFinished ID=3287 Time=03/05/2016 11:18:22 Item=my settings\links\RecentPlaces.lnk Folder=willenbrocka Error=>
2016-05-03 11:18:22.7276 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.TransferHistory.SyncthingTransferHistory: Item finished. Folder: willenbrocka, Item: my settings\links\RecentPlaces.lnk, Type: File, Action: Update

2016-05-03 11:18:22.7596 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.EventWatcher.SyncthingEventWatcher: <ItemFinished ID=3288 Time=03/05/2016 11:18:22 Item=my settings\links\Downloads.lnk Folder=willenbrocka Error=>
2016-05-03 11:18:22.7756 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.TransferHistory.SyncthingTransferHistory: Item finished. Folder: willenbrocka, Item: my settings\links\Downloads.lnk, Type: File, Action: Update
2016-05-03 11:18:22.7876 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.TransferHistory.SyncthingTransferHistory: File Transfer set to complete: <FileTransfer Folder=willenbrocka Path=my settings\links\Downloads.lnk Status=Completed ItemType=File ActionType=Update Started=03/05/2016 10:18:22 Finished=03/05/2016 10:18:22>

2016-05-03 11:18:22.8276 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.TransferHistory.SyncthingTransferHistory: Item finished. Folder: willenbrocka, Item: my settings\links\Desktop.lnk, Type: File, Action: Update
2016-05-03 11:18:22.8276 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.TransferHistory.SyncthingTransferHistory: File Transfer set to complete: <FileTransfer Folder=willenbrocka Path=my settings\links\Desktop.lnk Status=Completed ItemType=File ActionType=Update Started=03/05/2016 10:18:22 Finished=03/05/2016 10:18:22>
2016-05-03 11:18:22.8276 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.EventWatcher.SyncthingEventWatcher: <LocalIndexUpdated ID=3290 Time=03/05/2016 11:18:22 Folder=willenbrocka Items=27 Version=1447220>
2016-05-03 11:18:22.8276 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.EventWatcher.SyncthingEventWatcher: <StateChangedEvent ID=3291 Time=03/05/2016 11:18:22 Folder=willenbrocka From=syncing To=idle Duration=00:00:00.4700000>
2016-05-03 11:18:22.8276 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.EventWatcher.SyncthingEventWatcher: <FolderSummary ID=3292 Time=03/05/2016 11:18:22 Folder=willenbrocka Summary=<FolderStatus GlobalBytes=1419642039 GlobalDeleted=2 GlobalFiles=7061 LocalBytes=1419642039 LocalDeleted=2 LocalFiles=7061 InSyncBytes=1419642039 InSyncFiles=7061 NeedBytes=0 NeedFiles=0 Invalid= State=idle StateChanged=03/05/2016 11:18:22 Version=1447248>>
2016-05-03 11:18:22.8927 #5556 [Debug] SyncTrayzor.Syncthing.EventWatcher.SyncthingEventWatcher: <GenericEvent ID=3293 Type=FolderCompletion Time=03/05/2016 11:18:22 Data={"completion":0.0013015957186612859,"device":"UVYNR2C-BUN6GAN-MTOYD2J-BIK2QHN-DLU4K2T-N6BKANX-U5PJS5C-CSB7EAC","folder":"willenbrocka"}>
```

These files are just automatically created windows .lnk files so are not important, however I really wanted to make sure that this doesn't happen with other conflicted files and felt it was worth a bug report.

Thanks!
### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v0.12.22
OS Version: Windows 7 x64 / Windows Server 2012 R2

body: This is now solved upstream so it would be interesting to know if it now works for us or not.

issue.title: Support OneDrive folders on recent Windows 10

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Syncthing (v0.14.40) does not work with Onedrive on Windows 10 Fall Creator Update (version 1709) properly in some cases. 

In Win 10 Fall Creators Update, Microsoft changed how Onedrive operates NTFS filesystem. Now OneDrive creates [reparsepoints](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa365503(v=vs.85).aspx) (an NTFS feature). Syncthing forum user "geeksquad" explained it [here](https://forum.syncthing.net/t/folder-path-missing-even-the-path-exists-onedrive-win10-fall-creators-update/10913/4). It seems Syncthing is refusing to recognize a OneDrive directory using _reparsepoints_ and reports an error message "folder path missing". 

> [ZEER7] 12:49:24 WARNING: Creating folder marker: folder path missing
> [ZEER7] 12:49:24 INFO: Restarted folder "EXAMPLE" (xxxxx-yyyyy) (readwrite)
> [ZEER7] 12:49:24 INFO: Connection to WJXMAFI closed: reading length: read tcp 192.168.1.2:51413->192.168.1.3:22000: use of closed network connection
> [ZEER7] 12:49:24 WARNING: Error on folder "EXAMPLE" (xxxxx-yyyyy): folder path missing
> [ZEER7] 12:49:24 INFO: Failed initial scan of readwrite folder "EXAMPLE" (xxxxx-yyyyy)

I have 2 OneDrive synced directories on a same computer synced with Syncthing to a Linux server. Based on my experiments the following factors may impact on the success of getting Syncthing to sync a OneDrive folder: 

1. I have OneDrive Business and standard OneDrive folders and only the ordinary OneDrive folder syncs properly. There might or might not be a issue related to Onedrive Business. 
2.  In case of the (standard) OneDrive, the synced folder is not the root OneDrive folder, but a folder under the Onedrive root folder. Syncthing syncs this folder under the OneDrive root folder OK.
3. In the case of the OneDrive Business folder, I am trying to sync the OneDrive Business root folder, but after updating to Win10 Fall Creators Update, Syncthing stopped syncing this folder. 
4. Syncthing does not sync properly any OneDrive or OneDrive Business folder IF _Files On-demand_ feature has been enabled on the OneDrive. Microsoft introduced this feature in Win 10 Fall Creators Update and it is enabled by default. I have disabled it manually. 

### Version Information

Syncthing Version: v0.14.40 Win 64-bit
OS Version: Windows 10 Fall Creator Update (Version >= 1709 )

body:
I'm absolutely not a go dev but another go project solved it. Is it possible to follow the same route?
 https://github.com/minio/minio/pull/4203
We already have that fix by way of it being included in Go 1.9 which weve used for a while. If this still doesnt work, its something else.

thanks for the pointer, they indeed do still not work as of 0.14.42. 
This though begs a question....If that fix has been included upstream why does minio work flawlessy while syncthing doesn't ?
What exactly works in minio? Perhaps minio doesn't care about traversing symlinks.
minio can serve deduplicated files fine, so it found a way to read its contents as if there were "normal" files rather than symlinks.
Well we can read symlinks but we choose not to due to security implications.
Again this is the question. Do Windows present these files as symlinks? If so it is by design that we do not process them. If Windows does not, it's a bug that we don't process them.
Well I don't have windows with a fancy filesystem to verify this.
